title: U.S. Cyberattack Hurt Iran’s Ability to Target Oil Tankers
text:
I'm surprised this incident is being publicized...

"A secret cyberattack against Iran in June wiped out a critical database used by Iran’s paramilitary

arm to plot attacks against oil tankers and degraded Tehran’s ability to covertly target shipping

traffic in the Persian Gulf, at least temporarily, according to senior American officials."

"American cyberoperations are designed to change Iran’s behavior without initiating a broader

conflict or prompting retaliation, said Norman Roule, a former senior intelligence official.

Because they are rarely acknowledged publicly, cyberstrikes are much like covert operations, he said."
